title: 820-00165 no image no chime
message:
came in precleaned....

green light then orange.
ppbus_g3h 8.18volts (same as on working board from other MacBook)
Mouse lights up

PPVCC_S0_CPU 1.803v stable

PP5V_S0 5.12v
PP3V3_S0 3.332volt


missing
PP3V3_S0SW_LCD 0.000volt diode 0.532
U8300
PP3V3_S5 3.334 volt
EDP_PANEL_PWR  0.000volt comes from R1431 84.9kohm (on board) comes from U0500
EDP_PANEL_PWR 0.537diode on pin1 U8300 

PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT 0 volt

title: 820-00165 no image no chime
message: Does it do a PRAM reset? Mouse light should go off and on again. Caps lock working on an external keyboard?

title: 820-00165 no image no chime
message:
no response on pram reset mouse light wil dimm a little bit but wont turn off, tested on 3 keyboard+cables
bios replacement with pram reset bios? to reset then replace right?

title: 820-00165 no image no chime
message: Mouse will probably not light if you unplug and put it back in. This board is just brain dead and thus it could be anything. The usual suspects U1950, crap under SMC, clock chip.

title: 820-00165 no image no chime
message:
Mouse stil lights up even after 20 minutes after beeing on.

pulled in/out alot... and everytime works.

title: 820-00165 no image no chime
message: Is this some sort of mouse that always lights up? Try it on a known dead board that power on or a board without RAM, mouse should not light.

title: 820-00165 no image no chime
message: I got cought out with a mouse that did that. Had me stummped for ages.

title: 820-00165 no image no chime
message: on a know dead board it lights up for a few sec then turns off. also connected a external hdd/ssd caddy. same result on the 00165 keeps on, on the dead board turns off

title: 820-00165 no image no chime
message: Any boot activity from a bootable USB HDD/USB stick?
